title: TridentKV: A Read-Optimized LSM-tree Based KV Store via Adaptive Indexing and Space-Efficient Partitioning
abstract: LSM-tree based key-value (KV) stores suffer severe read performance loss due to the leveled structure of the LSM-tree. Especially, when modern storage devices with high bandwidth and low latency are used, the read performance of KV stores is seriously affected by inefficient file indexing. Besides, due to the deletion pattern of inserting tombstones, LSM-tree based KV stores are faced with the problem of read performance fluctuations that are caused by large-scale data deletion (also referred to as the Read-After-Delete problem). In this paper, TridentKV is proposed to improve the read performance of KV stores. An adaptive learned index structure is first designed to speed up file indexing. Also, a space-efficient partition strategy is proposed to solve the Read-After-Delete problem. Besides, asynchronous reading design is adopted, and SPDK is supported for high concurrency and low latency. TridentKV is implemented on RocksDB and the evaluation results indicate that compared with RocksDB, the read performance of TridentKV is improved by 7 to 12 without loss of write performance and TridentKV provides stable read performance even if a large number of deletions or migrations occur. Instead of RocksDB, TridentKV is exploited to store metadata in Ceph, which improves the read performance of Ceph by 20% to 60%.
tldr_ja: TridentKVは、LSMツリーに基づくキー・バリュー（KV）ストアの読み取り性能を改善するために提案されたシステムです。適応型インデックス構造と空間効率的なパーティショニングを採用し、削除後の読み取り問題を解決します。評価結果では、RocksDBと比較して読み取り性能が7～12%向上し、書き込み性能を損なうことなく、削除や移行が多発しても安定した読み取り性能を提供します。また、Cephでのメタデータストレージにも利用され、読み取り性能が20%～60%向上しました。
